myExercises.title: My Exercises
myExercises.activeProgramsDescription: Your current exercise programs based on pain assessments
myExercises.noEndedPrograms: You don't have any ended programs yet.

exercisePlanPage.generalDescription: Don't have time for individual programs? Here you'll find a personalized program with the most important exercises from your programs. Follow the instructions and stop exercising if you feel pain.
exercisePlanPage.title: Exercise Plan

exercisePlan.suitableQuestion: Is this exercise suitable for you?
exercisePlan.painQuestion: 1. Does this exercise cause you pain?
exercisePlan.changeQuestion: 2. Do you want to change this exercise?
exercisePlan.changeRequestInfo: After submitting this request, we will change your exercise.

importantNotice.title: Important Notice
importantNotice.text: These exercises are recommended based on your assessment. If you experience severe pain or discomfort, consult a healthcare professional.

generalProgram.title: General Program
generalProgram.description: Don't have time for individual programs? Here you'll find a personalized program with the most important exercises from your programs. Follow the instructions and stop exercising if you feel pain.

centralSensitisationNeck.title: Central Sensitization - Neck Pain Relief
centralSensitisationNeck.description: Exercise program for central sensitization affecting neck area. Focus on gentle movements and pain management.

wallBallMassage.title: Wall Ball Massage for Trapezius
wallBallMassage.description: Use a tennis ball against the wall to massage the trapezius muscle. Apply gentle pressure and move the ball slowly over tender areas for 2-3 minutes.

interscapularStrengthening.title: Interscapular Strengthening
interscapularStrengthening.description: Strengthen the muscles between your shoulder blades. Squeeze shoulder blades together, hold for 5-10 seconds, repeat 10-15 times.

wallPushUps.title: Wall Push-Ups
wallPushUps.description: Modified push-ups against the wall to strengthen shoulders and chest safely. Start with 10 repetitions, gradually increase.

centralSensitisationMiddleBack.title: Central Sensitization - Middle Back Relief
centralSensitisationMiddleBack.description: Targeted exercises for central sensitization affecting the middle back region.

prayer.title: Prayer Stretch
prayer.description: Kneel and sit back on your heels, extend arms forward and stretch the middle back. Hold for 30 seconds, repeat 3 times.

thoracicSpineMassage.title: Thoracic Spine Massage
thoracicSpineMassage.description: Use a foam roller or tennis ball to massage the thoracic spine. Roll slowly over the middle back for 2-3 minutes.

bookOpening.title: Book Opening Exercise
bookOpening.description: Lie on your side, open your arms like opening a book to stretch the thoracic spine. Hold for 30 seconds each side.

interscapularStrengthening.title: Interscapular Strengthening
interscapularStrengthening.description: Strengthen the muscles between your shoulder blades to improve posture and reduce pain.

centralSensitisationLowerBack.title: Central Sensitization - Lower Back Relief
centralSensitisationLowerBack.description: Exercise program for central sensitization affecting the lower back area.

glutealStretching.title: Gluteal Stretching
glutealStretching.description: Stretch the gluteal muscles to relieve lower back tension. Hold each stretch for 30 seconds, repeat 3 times per side.

bridge.title: Bridge Exercise
bridge.description: Strengthen your glutes and lower back. Lie on your back, lift hips up, hold for 5-10 seconds, repeat 10-15 times.

squats90.title: 90-Degree Squats
squats90.description: Perform squats with your back against the wall, knees at 90 degrees. Hold for 10-30 seconds, repeat 5-10 times.

defaultNeck.title: General Neck Pain Relief
defaultNeck.description: General exercise program for neck pain relief.

wallBallMassage.title: Wall Ball Massage
wallBallMassage.description: Use a tennis ball against the wall to massage neck and shoulder muscles.

interscapularStrengthening.title: Interscapular Strengthening
interscapularStrengthening.description: Strengthen the muscles between shoulder blades for better neck support.

wallPushUps.title: Wall Push-Ups
wallPushUps.description: Modified push-ups to strengthen neck and shoulder support muscles.

defaultMiddleBackWeek02.description: Initial phase exercises for middle back pain relief.

thoracicRotationWithExtension.title: Thoracic Rotation with Extension
thoracicRotationWithExtension.description: Gentle rotation and extension movements for the thoracic spine.

thoracicSpineMassage.description: Self-massage techniques for the thoracic spine area.

radicularPainNeckWeek03.description: Initial treatment for radicular neck pain.

neckRetraction.title: Neck Retraction
neckRetraction.description: Gently pull your chin back to create a double chin. Hold for 5 seconds, repeat 10 times.

upperLimbNeurodynamics.title: Upper Limb Neurodynamics
upperLimbNeurodynamics.description: Nerve mobilization exercises for the upper limb to reduce nerve irritation.

neckSideBending.title: Neck Side Bending
neckSideBending.description: Gently bend your neck to each side, hold for 15-30 seconds per side.

prayer.title: Prayer Stretch
prayer.description: Stretch for middle back and shoulder region.

thoracicSpineMassage.title: Thoracic Spine Massage
thoracicSpineMassage.description: Self-massage for thoracic spine tension relief.

bookOpening.title: Book Opening Exercise
bookOpening.description: Mobility exercise for thoracic spine rotation.

defaultLowerBack.title: General Lower Back Pain Management
defaultLowerBack.description: General exercises for lower back pain relief.

glutealStretching.title: Gluteal Stretching
glutealStretching.description: Stretch gluteal muscles to relieve lower back tension.

pelvicTilting.title: Pelvic Tilting
pelvicTilting.description: Gentle pelvic mobility exercises for lower back.

frozenShoulderPhase1.title: 0-2 week
frozenShoulderPhase1.description: The initial phase of exercises focuses on pain management and gentle mobility exercises. Perform these exercises 2-3 times a day.

pendulumExercises.title: Pendulum Exercises
pendulumExercises.description: Lean forward and perform swinging motions to maintain shoulder mobility without active movement. Perform 10-15 swings in each direction, 2-3 times daily.

isometricExternalRotation.title: Isometric External Rotation
isometricExternalRotation.description: Stand with your arm at your side, elbow bent 90 degrees. Press your hand against a wall or door frame without moving your arm. Hold for 8-10 seconds, repeat 5 times, 1-2 times daily.

rotatorCuffRelease.title: Rotator Cuff and Trapezius Ball Massage
rotatorCuffRelease.description: Use a tennis ball against the wall to massage the rotator cuff and trapezius muscles. Apply gentle pressure and slowly move over tender areas for 2-3 minutes daily.

shoulderHeating.title: Shoulder Heating
shoulderHeating.description: Apply heat to the shoulder area using a heating pad for 15-20 minutes before exercises to help relax muscles and reduce stiffness.

frozenShoulderPhase2.title: 3-5 week
frozenShoulderPhase2.description: Progressive strengthening phase as pain begins to subside. Focus on restoring shoulder strength and stability.

isometricShoulderPresses.title: Isometric Shoulder Presses
isometricShoulderPresses.description: Progressive strengthening exercises to restore shoulder muscle strength. Hold for 10-15 seconds, repeat 10-15 times.

wallPushUps.title: Wall Push-Ups
wallPushUps.description: Modified push-ups against the wall to safely strengthen shoulder and chest muscles. Start with 10 repetitions, gradually increase.

interscapularStrengthening.title: Interscapular Strengthening
interscapularStrengthening.description: Strengthening exercises for muscles between the shoulder blades to improve posture and shoulder stability. Perform 10-15 repetitions.

subacromialImpingement.title: Subacromial Impingement Syndrome - Pain Relief and Mobility
subacromialImpingement.description: Exercises designed to reduce impingement and improve shoulder mechanics. Focus on creating space in the shoulder joint.

interscapularStrengthening.title: Interscapular Strengthening
interscapularStrengthening.description: Strengthen muscles that pull shoulder blades together to improve shoulder positioning and reduce impingement.

gentlePendulum.title: Gentle Pendulum Movements
gentlePendulum.description: Light pendulum movements to maintain mobility without aggravating impingement. Keep movements small and pain-free.

preExerciseHeating.title: Pre-Exercise Heating
preExerciseHeating.description: Warming exercises to prepare the shoulder joint before performing other therapeutic exercises.

rotatorCuffTear.title: Rotator Cuff Tear - Conservative Treatment
rotatorCuffTear.description: Conservative treatment focused on pain management and maintaining available range of motion.

isometricStrengthening.title: Isometric Strengthening
isometricStrengthening.description: Gentle strengthening without movement to prevent further damage while maintaining muscle tone.

rotatorCuffMassage.title: Rotator Cuff Massage
rotatorCuffMassage.description: Self-massage techniques to improve circulation and reduce muscle tension around the rotator cuff.

defaultNociceptive.title: General Shoulder Pain Management
defaultNociceptive.description: General exercises for shoulder pain when specific diagnosis is unclear. Focus on basic mobility and gentle strengthening.

basicMobility.title: Basic Shoulder Mobility
basicMobility.description: Basic exercises to maintain or restore fundamental shoulder range of motion.

basicStrengthening.title: Basic Shoulder Strengthening
basicStrengthening.description: Simple strengthening exercises suitable for most shoulder conditions.
